reviews.text:
I'll start by saying that the rooms are small. With very little space in them.

Otherwise, this hotel is perfect. The staff are exceptionally friendly and professional.

The breakfast on offer everyday is beyond outstanding. The selection is the absolute best we have ever encountered anywhere in the world.

The location is perfect. It's close to every form of transport you will need. Furthermore, the rooms are quiet, you can hardly hear anything.

Staff were wonderfully helpful and cheerful at every turn - could not have been more gracious. Location is amazing. Breakfast was fantastic. Rooms are on the smaller side but that's the tradeoff for being in such a central location.

Very nice hotel in the city center. The staff is friendly. The breakfast is superb. However, our room had no windows. Another big downside is that you have to book your breakfast time in advance (never seen that before). We ended up setting our alarm to be able to go down for breakfast. Not something you want on holidays.

Perfect location . Rooms are very small. Breakfast is good but you have to book your slot daily which could be little daunting.

However when I booked my stay I had booked superior double room, but when I got the room allocated I felt it was to smaller and it looked like a standard room.

I chose one of the small "cabin" rooms without a window, which was brilliant for keeping traffic noise and early-morning sunlight out. However, the walls seem to be quite thin, so things were not always silent.
Monsoon showers are always good, and the breakfast buffet was extensive, but the centralised heating was still stuck on summer mode at the end of September, which made the room quite cold
Easy walk from the railway station and bus terminal
